methods.name: attachDialog

methods.description: Attaches the portal to the dialog reference and returns the dialog reference.

jsdoctags.comment: • The dialog reference.

methods.name: createDialog
methods.rawdescription: Creates and opens a dialog with the specified configuration and component.
methods.description: Creates and opens a dialog with the specified configuration and component.

jsdoctags.comment: • The configuration object for the dialog, including overlay settings.
• The component to be rendered inside the dialog.
• Optional array of providers to be injected into the dialog.
• A reference to the created dialog overlay.

methods.name: openComponentDialog
methods.rawdescription: Opens a component dialog with the specified configuration and providers.
methods.description: Opens a component dialog with the specified configuration and providers.

jsdoctags.comment: • The configuration object for the component dialog.
• Optional array of providers to be injected into the dialog.
• A reference to the created dialog overlay.

methods.name: openDefaultDialog
methods.rawdescription: Opens a default dialog with the specified configuration.
methods.description: Opens a default dialog with the specified configuration.

jsdoctags.comment: • The configuration object for the default dialog.
• A reference to the created dialog overlay.

injectables.description:
Service to manage and open dialog overlays in the application.

The DialogService provides methods to open default dialogs and component-based dialogs with specified configurations and providers. It utilizes an internal reference builder and injector to create and manage dialog overlays.

Example :
// Injecting DialogService in a component
constructor(private dialogService: DialogService) {}

// Opening a default dialog const config: DefaultDialogConfig = { /* configuration options */ }; const dialogRef = this.dialogService.openDefaultDialog(config);

// Opening a component-based dialog const componentConfig: DialogComponentConfig = { /* configuration options */ }; const dialogRef = this.dialogService.openComponentDialog(componentConfig);

Hello there, Welcome skeleton

You're up and running

What's next?

Learning materials

Documentation Everything is in there Blog Changelog, features & events YouTube channel Nx Show, talks & tutorials Interactive tutorials Create an app, step-by-step
Nx is open source Love Nx? Give us a star!
Install Nx Console for VSCode The official VSCode extension for Nx. Install Nx Console for JetBrains Available for WebStorm, Intellij IDEA Ultimate and more!

Nx Cloud Enable faster CI & better DX

You can activate distributed tasks executions and caching by running:

nx connect
What is Nx Cloud?

Next steps

Here are some things you can do with Nx:

Build, test and lint your app 
# Build
nx build
# Test
nx test
# Lint
nx lint
# Run them together!
nx run-many -t build test lint
View project details 
nx show project skeleton
View interactive project graph 
nx graph
Add UI library 
# Generate UI lib
nx g @nx/angular:lib ui
# Add a component
nx g @nx/angular:component ui/src/lib/button

Carefully crafted with

variables.name: addTodolistEntity
variables.defaultValue:
createAction(
  `${PREFIX} Add TodolistEntity`,
  props<{ entity: TaskEntity }>()
)

variables.name: appConfig
ColorStyleMapper
DEFAULT_CHECKBOX_CLASSES
variables.defaultValue: "flex h-6 w-6 cursor-pointer items-center justify-center rounded-md border border-gray-500 text-white transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out peer-checked:border-gray-500 peer-checked:bg-black-200"

variables.name: deleteEntity
variables.defaultValue:
createAction(
  `${PREFIX} Delete TodolistEntity`,

)

variables.name: hmrBootstrap
loadTodolistEntitiesFailure
variables.defaultValue:
createAction(
  `${PREFIX} Load TodolistEntities Failure`,
  props<{ error: unknown }>()
)

variables.name: loadTodolistEntitiesSuccess
variables.defaultValue:
createAction(
  `${PREFIX} Load TodolistEntities Success`,
  props<{ entities: TaskEntity[] }>()
)

variables.name: meta
MOCK_CONFIG
MOCK_CONFIG2
todolistEntityAdapter
todolistEntityReducer
variables.defaultValue:
createReducer(
  initialState,
  on(loadTodolistEntitiesSuccess, (state, { entities }) => todolistEntityAdapter.setAll(entities, state)),
  on(addTodolistEntity, (state, { entity }) => todolistEntityAdapter.addOne(entity, state)),
  on(updateTodolistEntity, (state, { entity }) => todolistEntityAdapter.updateOne({ id: entity.id, changes: entity }, state)),
  on(deleteEntity, (state, { id }) => todolistEntityAdapter.removeOne(id, state)),
)

variables.name: TodolistSignalStore
updateTodolistEntity
variables.defaultValue:
createAction(
  `${PREFIX} Update TodolistEntity`,
  props<{ entity: TaskEntity }>()
)

functions.name: createRefBuilder
functions.description: Creates a reference builder function that can be used to create overlay references with a specified configuration and position strategy.

jsdoctags.comment: • The OverlayPositionBuilder instance used to generate position strategies.
• The Overlay instance used to create overlay references.
A function that takes an overlay configuration and an optional position strategy, and returns an object containing the created OverlayRef and a decorated reference.

functions.name: createRefInjector
functions.description: Creates an injector with the specified providers and a parent injector.

jsdoctags.comment: • The parent injector.
The created injector.

functions.name: generateFlexiblePosition
functions.description: Generates a flexible connected position strategy for an overlay.

jsdoctags.comment: • The OverlayPositionBuilder used to create the position strategy.
• The target element to which the overlay will be connected. This can be an ElementRef or an Element.
• An array of ConnectedPosition objects that define the preferred positions for the overlay.
A FlexibleConnectedPositionStrategy configured with the specified positions.

functions.name: generateGlobalCenterPosition
functions.description:
Generates a global center position strategy for an overlay.

This function uses the provided OverlayPositionBuilder to create a GlobalPositionStrategy that centers the overlay both horizontally and vertically on the screen.

jsdoctags.comment: • The OverlayPositionBuilder used to create the position strategy.
A GlobalPositionStrategy that centers the overlay on the screen.

typealiases.name: DecorateRefBuilder
typealiases.description: Type definition for a function that decorates a reference builder.

typealiases.name: DialogType
typealiases.description: Represents the configuration type for a dialog. It can be either a DialogComponentConfig or a DefaultDialogConfig.
